summary: A very interesting option is Sterling, which sounds a bit like an object oriented database: > Sterling can serialize almost any > class and organizes instances using > keys that you provide (any property on > the instance may be designated as the > key).  Sterling also provides indexes > that can be queried in memory for > speed before loading [Uh, yep it is exactly that.](https://sterling.codeplex.com/) I'm pulling XML and JSON files and as such I think it is most efficient to just cache these, allowing hydration of the object model from the URL resource or the disk.
title: Building a Windows Phone App Part 3
